edu.rice.comp440.rovers.model.percepts

Class SmartPercepts.SmartRoverMemory

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rice.comp440.rovers.model.percepts.SmartPercepts.SmartRoverMemory
  • Enclosing class:
    SmartPercepts

    public class SmartPercepts.SmartRoverMemory
extends java.lang.Object
    A place where the user can store information to help the Smart Rover persist some decisions or states between steps.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmartPercepts.SmartRoverMemory

        public SmartPercepts.SmartRoverMemory()

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Returns a state set previously by the user. This state has no meaning to the simulation, it is reserved for the user to use however they wish.
        Returns:
        A state that the user set previously.

      • setState

        public void setState(int _state)
        Set a state. The "state" is not used by the simulator, and is merely provided to the user so that they can define their own semantic for it. getState(...) will return the state set with this function.
        Parameters:
        _state - The new value for the state.

      • getGoal

        public Position getGoal()
        Get a goal previously set by the user.
        Returns:
        The user-set goal.

      • setGoal

        public void setGoal(Position _goal)
        Set the goal that will be returned by getGoal(...).
        Parameters:
        _goal - A goal.

      • getGoalPath

        public java.util.List<Position> getGoalPath()
        Get a previously user-set path to the user's goal (or to anything else, really, as the user defines the meaning).
        Returns:

      • setGoalPath

        public void setGoalPath(java.util.List<Position> path)
        Set a path.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to set.

      • getCachedAction

        public Action getCachedAction(int index)
        Retrieve an action that the user set previously.
        Parameters:
        index - 0 <= index < 5
        Returns:
        The "index-th" action that the user saved before.

      • setCachedAction

        public void setCachedAction(int index,
                   Action action)
        Save some action in one of 5 slots.
        Parameters:
        index - 0 <= index < 5
        action - The action to save.

      • getCachedPosition

        public Position getCachedPosition(int index)
        Similar to getCachedAction, but for positions.
        Parameters:
        index - 0 <= index < 20
        Returns:
        Return a saved position.

      • setCachedPosition

        public void setCachedPosition(int index,
                     Position position)
        Similar to setCachedAction, but for positions.
        Parameters:
        index - 0 <= index < 20
        position - Set the "index-th" position in the cache.
